author: Staff Reporter
text:
The organs of a brain dead accident victim from Hosur were harvested and his heart was donated to a 19-year-old in a private hospital in Bengaluru.

Santosh (21), a photographer, and son of a farmer couple in Kakkadasam in Hosur, was returning home on his two-wheeler on March 18, when he was fatally knocked down by a speeding lorry along Hosur-Bagalur road.

Santosh was admitted to Hosur Government Hospital and was later rushed to a private hospital in Bengaluru. He was declared as brain dead over the week-end and his family was informed. His parents Rajappa and Sharadha, and sister Sneha gave consent to donate his organs.

Santosh’s heart was donated to save the life of a 19-year-old boy. His other organs including eyes, kidneys were also harvested.

Santosh’s body was brought to his village and kept for public to pay respects.
title: Brain dead youth’s organs harvested
